name: 28th International Sculpture Conference
content: The International Sculpture Center (ISC) will hold the 28th International Sculpture Conference: Defining Moments in the Face of Change in Philadelphia, PA from October 25-28, 2018\. This four-day conference will bring together a diverse audience of artists, educators, arts administrators, museum directors, collectors, patrons, students, and sculpture enthusiasts. Conference programming will include the annual ISC littleSCULPTURE show; ARTSlams & mentor sessions; engaging panel discussions at Moore College of Art & Design; keynote address by Doris Salcedo; evening networking events; optional art & culture trips; free admission to the Barnes Foundation and Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts; and conference activities in collaboration with Grounds For Sculpture and The Seward Johnson Atelier. Pre- and post-conference tours, activities, and workshops will be held October 24th, 25th, and 29th. Register Now! Registration is open and available to ISC members, non-members, students, and all those with an interest in sculpture. Join us in Philadelphia where we will discuss exciting topics in contemporary sculpture! For details about the conference and other ISC events visit the ISC website at www.sculpture.org/philly2018, or by contacting the ISC Events Department at events@sculpture.org.
